benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to payment

covered: Valid Request: Tests TC01-TC04 and TC17-TC20 demonstrate successful updates with 204 responses and correct DB state.
Non-Existing Resource: TC06 tests 404 for non-existent payment.
Authorization: TC11 tests 401 unauthorized when token missing/invalid.
Server Error Handling: TC12 tests 500 on DB unavailable or dependency failure.
Validation: TC05 (invalid paymentId format), TC07 (missing required header), TC08 (missing body), TC09 (malformed JSON), TC10 (invalid CustomField data) cover input validation and error handling.
Edge Cases and robustness: TC14 (large payload), TC15 (max length), TC16 (extra unexpected params), TC18 (duplicate field names) test edge cases.
Integration: TC17 confirms data consistency by retrieving updated custom fields after update.
Concurrency: TC19 confirms system behavior under concurrent updates to ensure data integrity.
gaps: Partial Update: No explicit test to verify partial vs full replacement semantics for PUT (the tests assume full replacement).
Rate Limiting: No tests for rate limiting or throttling of the endpoint.
Caching Behavior: No tests for caching headers (ETag/Cache-Control).
Pagination: Not applicable/No pagination testing required for this endpoint; may be reported as a gap if large datasets are considered.
recommendations: Add Partial Update acceptance tests if partial updates are allowed; otherwise, clearly document replacement semantics and add tests for attempted partial updates (to ensure proper rejection).
Add rate-limiting tests to validate throttling behavior under bursts of PUT requests to the endpoint.
Add caching validation tests for ETag/Cache-Control to verify caching behavior and correctness of responses.
Consider dedicated race-condition tests focused on concurrent updates to the same payment to validate proper synchronization and data integrity.
